text:
AddOutputFilterByType filters aren't being applied to resources found through a
DirectoryIndex directive.  E.g.:

| DirectoryIndex default
| AddOutputFilterByType INCLUDES text/html

This won't apply the INCLUDES filter to a resource called "/foo/default.html" if
requested as "/foo" or /foo/", but *will* apply the filter if requested as
"/foo/default" (using Options MultiViews) or "/foo/default.html".

Currently, I'm using this instead:

  DirectoryIndex default
  <FilesMatch "\.xhtml(\..+)?$">
      SetOutputFilter INCLUDES
  </FilesMatch>

Ugly.
creator: julian@mehnle.net

text:
AddOutputFilterByType is a recent addition, and doesn't fit the filter
architecture.  Please see/join/contribute to the current discussion of Smart
Filtering on dev@httpd, and at http://www.apachetutor.org/dev/smart-filter.

Well, I have read http://www.apachetutor.org/dev/smart-filter, and I sure think
